title: Cityhunter34
author: Cityhunter34
content: My people I greet una o, As our people say person wey ask for road direction no dey lost and as I no wan lost and be left behind na em I say make I ask small questions for directions.I've often seen posts that says a newbie should read more and I've been doing just that, I don read, read, read sotey my eye dey turn me. But what is a student without a teacher? Make senior men Dem for here help me out with replies wey go butter my bread, make I know if I dey on the right track. I've been reading and going through posts of legends to learn how to make quality post as required of me but how do I learn if I don't get feedbacks to know if am doing the right thing? And talking about spamming and plagiarism, how do I know if the post am about to post has been posted here before?Una say as a newbie make person dey ask questions, I don ask my own o, and I hope it makes sense. I just need some help to grow.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: There's a saying that when you go to a foreign land, you do like they do there. It is not possible to learn when you cannot take the time to read what others are saying. If you go onto the beginners and help board, you will see some newbies create threads on how to know their way around the forum, and they are always referred to some helpful links. If you read through those links, you will learn about the forum and also about Bitcoin. On this forum, you are open to different boards and threads to which you can contribute positively with your own thought (logic), or if you have had experience with the topic, you can share. Don't copy and paste; it's called plagiarism, and you can be banned for such an act.

comments.created_time: November 09, 2023, 05:41:05 PMLast edit: November 10, 2023, 10:37:27 AM by Franctoshi
comments.body: You did the right my brother by seeking advice and clear direction to navigate your way safely in this forum, I would advise you to stick to writing a post that is only coming from you, and which could be from your life experiences or knowledge within and outside the cryptocurrency space, don't go copying anything aside from what you have to offer and if you do so provide a link to where you copied such articles or material from to spare your account from being flag as committed plagiarism. Furthermore, to succeed here find areas where you are good at learning if you don't have much to offer and develop your knowledge. Take you for instance, some are good with trading just like me, while some have good knowledge about Bitcoin, and some are good when it comes to economics, politics, gambling, etc, whichever one you find easy to learn or contribute then go for it and have quality contribution in those boards, but never forget the main purpose of this forum is aimed at spreading information about Bitcoin.   Then after you have done that, start practicing and passing that knowledge or information to those whom you would find in your shoes in the future.I hope this little contribution can be of help to you.
